page.title: 03HARDY THE AUTHOR
page.content: Two of{Thomas Hardy's}major novels are set in the area. One called{"The {Return of the Native"}is set on{Egdon {Heath}(Hardy's name for{Puddletown}and {Bhompston Heaths}). At the time which he set the story, these were not covered with trees, as now, but were covered by rough grass, heath, furze and scrubby trees. The inhabitants of neighbouring villages would get some rough grazing there for their animals and to encourage the growth of grass, would clear the furze and burn it. The bonfires from furze burning are mentioned several times in the novel. The principal characters are the Yeobrights who lived at{"Blooms-End". This has been identified with {Bhompston Farm.}Another place mentioned is the{"Quiet Woman Inn" which is tentatively identified as {Duck Dairy House.
